head.title: Has It Come to This? Spacious, Arctic Vu

hedline.hl1: Has It Come to This? Spacious, Arctic Vu

block.p: You quote a Canadian provincial official as saying, ''It's the positive side of global warming, if there is a positive side.'' That must be the poorest, most absurd excuse to ransack one of the last remaining wildernesses for gain.
We don't need more oil; we need an alternative engine so that our lust for autos and self-aggrandizing need for bigger cars can be satisfied.

You quote a Canadian provincial official as saying, ''It's the positive side of global warming, if there is a positive side.'' That must be the poorest, most absurd excuse to ransack one of the last remaining wildernesses for gain.
We don't need more oil; we need an alternative engine so that our lust for autos and self-aggrandizing need for bigger cars can be satisfied.

This area should not be pillaged. Nature in its wisdom created the Arctic region for balance. The more that man in his hubris thinks that he can control nature to his end, the greater we will all suffer.
Must we invade every place? When is enough consumption enough?
